intro: Euphrasia multiflora, commonly known as the pretty willow herb, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, erect stems and clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. Euphrasia multiflora is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
